Text: shouldn't it be called a quadrilogy?
This is the name off the site, just moved all the info over =)

Oh and 

A tetralogy is a compound work that is made up of four (numerical prefix tetra-) distinct works, just as a trilogy is made up of three works.
The term "quadrilogy", a nonce word basing the prefix on Latin prefix quadri- instead of the Greek prefix

"Quadrilogy" is not a real word.  Neither is "prequel", along with many other words you might expect to see on a dvd/blu-ray package or movie poster.  

Lesson: Don't rely on the entertainment industry for your vocabulary.

I'm actually shocked that the site used the real word!
